abstract: Browser cookies store the information used to log in to websites like Gmail, and a user can adjust a browser’s settings to manage them
snippet: Browser cookies store the information used to log in to websites like Gmail, and a user can adjust a browser’s settings to manage them
lead_paragraph: Q. I keep checking the box to stay signed into my Gmail account when I log into the Firefox browser on my Mac, but when I quit the program, the browser never retains the information and I have to keep logging in and typing in the security code that gets texted to my phone. How can I get Firefox to remember me?
